body:
**Actionable comments posted: 17** > [!CAUTION] > Some comments are outside the diff and can‚Äôt be posted inline due to platform limitations. > > > >
> ‚ö†Ô∏è Outside diff range comments (1)
> >
> .claude/skills/hook-developer/SKILL.md (1)
> > `1-73`: **Reference files exist but SubagentStart schema is missing.** > > The reference files are present and largely complete: > - `schemas.md` documents 10 of 11 hook types with detailed Input/Output schemas > - `patterns.md` delivers 6 illustrated hook patterns with working code examples > - `testing.md` provides manual test commands and a comprehensive debugging checklist > > However, **SubagentStart** (referenced in SKILL.md line 20) lacks schema documentation in `schemas.md`. All other hook events (PreToolUse, PostToolUse, UserPromptSubmit, PermissionRequest, SessionStart, SessionEnd, Stop/SubagentStop, PreCompact, Notification) are documented. > > Add SubagentStart schema to `ref/schemas.md` to complete the promised coverage. > >
> >
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ```` In @.claude/skills/braintrust-tracing/SKILL.md: - Around line 13-24: Update the code fence containing the ASCII architecture diagram (the triple-backtick block that shows "PARENT SESSION", "SessionStart (root span)", "UserPromptSubmit (Turn span)", "PostToolUse", "PreToolUse (Task)", "SUB-AGENT (NEW root_span_id)") to include a language identifier for plain text (e.g., change ``` to ```text or ```""```) so the diagram is explicitly marked as ASCII/text. In @.claude/skills/discovery-interview/SKILL.md: - Around line 1-66: SKILL.md references two missing files (`ref/spec-template.md` and `ref/user-types.md`) causing runtime cat failures; fix by either creating those files with the expected contents (a spec template matching the tool's spec output format and a user-types guide that enumerates persona categories and handling rules) and adding them under `ref/` so `cat ref/spec-template.md` and `cat ref/user-types.md` succeed, or remove the two `cat` reference lines from SKILL.md and update the "References" section to only list existing files (e.g., `cat ref/categories.md`) so there are no broken instructions; update SKILL.md accordingly and ensure the Iteration Rules still point to valid resources. In @.claude/skills/explore/SKILL.md: - Line 13: The fenced code block showing bash usage examples is missing a language specifier; update the triple-backtick fence before the block to include "bash" so it reads ```bash and keep the closing ``` unchanged, ensuring the examples (/explore, /explore , /explore ) are recognized as bash for linting and syntax highlighting. - Around line 79-82: The SKILL.md contains dangling references to ref/search-patterns.md and ref/architecture.md; either create those two files under .claude/skills/explore/ref with the expected content (search patterns and architecture checklist) and commit them, or remove the two reference lines in SKILL.md (the "For search patterns: `cat ref/search-patterns.md`" and "For architecture checklists: `cat ref/architecture.md`" lines) so they no longer point to non-existent files; update SKILL.md accordingly and ensure any README or index links are consistent with the change. In @.claude/skills/fix/SKILL.md: - Around line 13-20: The code block in SKILL.md starting with "/fix [options] [description]" lacks a language identifier; update the opening fence to include a language (e.g., change "```" to "```bash") so the usage examples like "/fix", "/fix bug", "/fix hook", etc., are syntax-highlighted and clearer. - Around line 58-61: The SKILL.md References section points to three files but only workflows.md exists; either create the missing documentation files (.claude/skills/fix/ref/question-flow.md and .claude/skills/fix/ref/handoff.md) with the promised content or remove the invalid reference lines from .claude/skills/fix/SKILL.md; update the References block so it only lists existing files (e.g., keep "cat ref/workflows.md") and add new markdown files with appropriate headings and content if you choose to create the missing docs. In @.claude/skills/help/SKILL.md: - Around line 20-55: The help file .claude/skills/help/SKILL.md incorrectly references the nonexistent skill `/create_plan`; remove the `/create_plan` entry from the "Planning & Research" list (or replace it with the correct existing skill name if this functionality was consolidated elsewhere) so the listed commands match actual .claude/skills/* SKILL.md files; update the single line that currently reads "`/create_plan` - Create implementation plan from requirements" accordingly and ensure spacing/ordering remains consistent. - Around line 65-67: The SKILL.md document references missing files ref/skill-list.md and ref/creating-skills.md; fix by either adding a new ref/ directory next to .claude/skills/help/ containing skill-list.md and creating-skills.md with the appropriate contents, or remove/update the reference lines in .claude/skills/help/SKILL.md so they no longer point to non-existent files; ensure the change targets the reference text mentioning `ref/skill-list.md` and `ref/creating-skills.md` in SKILL.md. In @.claude/skills/implement_task/SKILL.md: - Around line 51-56: Update the fenced code block in SKILL.md to include a language identifier (e.g., use ```text or ```markdown) so the example is lint-compliant; locate the block showing "Task [N] Complete / Status: [success/partial/blocked] / Handoff: [path] / Summary: [1-2 sentences]" and prepend the fence with a language token (for example change ``` to ```text) leaving the block contents unchanged and close with the existing ``` fence. In @.claude/skills/plan-agent/SKILL.md: - Around line 14-16: The fenced code block showing the usage example for the plan-agent command lacks a language specifier; update the code fence that contains "/plan-agent [description or ticket reference]" to use a bash language identifier (i.e., change ``` to ```bash) so linting and syntax highlighting recognize it. In @.claude/skills/premortem/SKILL.md: - Around line 13-16: Update the usage code block in SKILL.md to specify the shell language so syntax highlighting is clear: change the opening fence from ``` to ```bash for the block containing "/premortem # Full analysis" and "/premortem quick # Fast check before implementation", leaving the content and closing fence unchanged. In @.claude/skills/research/SKILL.md: - Around line 58-60: The SKILL.md references a non-existent file (ref/agents.md); either create ref/agents.md with the expected content or remove the reference invocation (`cat ref/agents.md`) from .claude/skills/research/SKILL.md; if creating the file, follow the style of ref/research-template.md so the command `cat ref/agents.md` runs without error and contains the agent documentation required by the skill. In @.claude/skills/tdd/ref/test-patterns.md: - Around line 95-100: Update the fenced code block that contains the directory tree starting with "tests/" so it includes a language identifier (e.g., add "text" after the opening ```). Locate the markdown block that shows the tree with "tests/ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ unit/ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ integration/ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ e2e/" and change the opening fence to ```text to mark it as plain text (or use an appropriate alternative markdown formatting for directory structures). In @.claude/skills/tdd/SKILL.md: - Around line 50-57: Update the fenced code block containing the test naming examples to include a language specifier (e.g., change the opening triple backticks to "```text" or "```plaintext") so the block like the one showing "test___" and the example lines ("test_login_valid_credentials_returns_token", etc.) is consistently highlighted/parsed. - Around line 72-75: The SKILL.md References section mentions ref/frameworks.md which doesn't exist; create a new file named ref/frameworks.md (or if the reference is incorrect remove the reference from .claude/skills/tdd/SKILL.md) ‚Äî if creating the file, add a concise framework guide that lists supported frameworks, quick setup steps, common test/runner commands, configuration examples, and any repo-specific conventions so the reference resolves and developers can follow framework setup from SKILL.md. ````
üßπ Nitpick comments (4)
.claude/skills/fix/SKILL.md (1)
`1-5`: **Consider adding `user-invocable: true` flag.** The corresponding `premortem/SKILL.md` file (line 4) includes `user-invocable: true`, which signals that the skill is intended for direct user invocation. For consistency and clarity, consider adding this flag to `fix/SKILL.md` as well if users are expected to invoke it directly.
.claude/skills/braintrust-tracing/SKILL.md (1)
`60-63`: **Clarify reference guidance in References section.** The `cat ref/...` syntax reads like CLI instructions rather than documentation pointers. Reword to clarify that these are reference files, not commands to execute.
‚ôªÔ∏è Proposed fix ```diff -## References +## References -For state management: `cat ref/state.md` -For debugging commands: `cat ref/debugging.md` -For sub-agent correlation details: `cat ref/subagent-correlation.md` +- **State management**: See `ref/state.md` +- **Debugging commands**: See `ref/debugging.md` +- **Sub-agent correlation details**: See `ref/subagent-correlation.md` ```
.claude/skills/discovery-interview/ref/categories.md (1)
`1-1`: **Consider strengthening the heading phrasing.** "Category Deep Dive Questions" is clear but generic. Consider phrasing like "Category Deep Dive Questions" ‚Üí "Category Exploration Framework" or "Probing Questions by Domain" to emphasize the investigative intent.
.claude/skills/discovery-interview/SKILL.md (1)
`11-13`: **Minor style note: repetitive word beginnings.** Lines 12‚Äì13 begin three successive sentences with "Don't" ("Don't ask...", "Don't accept...", "Don't assume..."). While this creates emphasis, consider varying sentence structure slightly for readability. For example: - "Don't ask obvious questions." - "Surface answers aren't enough; dig deeper." - "Avoid assumptions about what users know." This is optional and context-dependent; the current phrasing may be intentionally emphatic for the guidance's tone.
üìú Review details **Configuration used**: Organization UI **Review profile**: CHILL **Plan**: Pro **Knowledge base: Disabled due to `Reviews -> Disable Knowledge Base` setting**
üì• Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between f78fd0d4562ed00058836fee529a51ffb032e5ca and 9085bfcd4747222607327b7c6ebccc885dd731a9.
üìí Files selected for processing (22) * `.claude/skills/braintrust-tracing/SKILL.md` * `.claude/skills/braintrust-tracing/ref/state.md` * `.claude/skills/discovery-interview/SKILL.md` * `.claude/skills/discovery-interview/ref/categories.md` * `.claude/skills/explore/SKILL.md` * `.claude/skills/fix/SKILL.md` * `.claude/skills/fix/ref/workflows.md` * `.claude/skills/help/SKILL.md` * `.claude/skills/hook-developer/SKILL.md` * `.claude/skills/hook-developer/ref/patterns.md` * `.claude/skills/hook-developer/ref/schemas.md` * `.claude/skills/hook-developer/ref/testing.md` * `.claude/skills/implement_task/SKILL.md` * `.claude/skills/implement_task/ref/handoff-template.md` * `.claude/skills/plan-agent/SKILL.md` * `.claude/skills/plan-agent/SKILL.v6.md` * `.claude/skills/premortem/SKILL.md` * `.claude/skills/research/SKILL.md` * `.claude/skills/research/SKILL.md.bak` * `.claude/skills/research/ref/research-template.md` * `.claude/skills/tdd/SKILL.md` * `.claude/skills/tdd/ref/test-patterns.md`
üí§ Files with no reviewable changes (2) * .claude/skills/plan-agent/SKILL.v6.md * .claude/skills/research/SKILL.md.bak
üß∞ Additional context used
ü™õ LanguageTool
.claude/skills/discovery-interview/ref/categories.md [style] ~1-~1: Consider a different adjective to strengthen your wording. Context: # Category Deep Dive Questions ## Category A: Problem ... (DEEP_PROFOUND)
.claude/skills/discovery-interview/SKILL.md [style] ~13-~13: Three successive sentences begin with the same word. Consider rewording the sentence or use a thesaurus to find a synonym. Context: ...uestions. Don't accept surface answers. Don't assume knowledge.** ## Interview Pr... (ENGLISH_WORD_REPEAT_BEGINNING_RULE)
ü™õ markdownlint-cli2 (0.18.1)
.claude/skills/braintrust-tracing/SKILL.md 5-5: Fenced code blocks should have a language specified (MD040, fenced-code-language) --- 26-26: Fenced code blocks should have a language specified (MD040, fenced-code-language)
.claude/skills/tdd/ref/test-patterns.md 95-95: Fenced code blocks should have a language specified (MD040, fenced-code-language)
.claude/skills/explore/SKILL.md 13-13: Fenced code blocks should have a language specified (MD040, fenced-code-language)
.claude/skills/fix/SKILL.md 13-13: Fenced code blocks should have a language specified (MD040, fenced-code-language)
.claude/skills/plan-agent/SKILL.md 14-14: Fenced code blocks should have a language specified (MD040, fenced-code-language)
.claude/skills/tdd/SKILL.md 50-50: Fenced code blocks should have a language specified (MD040, fenced-code-language)
.claude/skills/implement_task/SKILL.md 5-5: Fenced code blocks should have a language specified (MD040, fenced-code-language) --- 23-23: Fenced code blocks should have a language specified (MD040, fenced-code-language) --- 41-41: Fenced code blocks should have a language specified (MD040, fenced-code-language) --- 63-63: Fenced code blocks should have a language specified (MD040, fenced-code-language)
.claude/skills/premortem/SKILL.md 13-13: Fenced code blocks should have a language specified (MD040, fenced-code-language)
üîá Additional comments (15)
.claude/skills/research/ref/research-template.md (1)
`1-64`: **Well-structured research document template with clear guidance.** The frontmatter block, section hierarchy, and rules provide a solid foundation for standardized research note-taking. The dual timestamp approach (ISO for dynamic fields, date-only for tracking) is pragmatic and clearly labeled.
.claude/skills/hook-developer/ref/schemas.md (1)
`1-155`: **Comprehensive hook schemas with strong critical callouts.** The schemas cover all documented hook events and highlight two important behavioral safeguards (tool_response field naming at line 49 and stop_hook_active check at line 130). The JSON structures are valid and the input fields are well-documented. Minor observations: - **UserPromptSubmit output (lines 60‚Äì71):** The output description only mentions "Plain text stdout added to context, or JSON with `{"decision": "block", "reason": "..."}`". This is brief; consider clarifying the default behavior when no JSON output is provided. - **PostToolUse output (lines 52‚Äì58):** The output schema is minimal (decision, reason, hookSpecificOutput). Verify this is intentionally simpler than PreToolUse. - **CLAUDE_ENV_FILE reference (line 106):** Useful guidance, but no detail on format or lifecycle. This is fine for a reference doc, as it assumes the skill SKILL.md covers implementation details.
.claude/skills/help/SKILL.md (1)
`1-5`: **Confirm frontmatter changes maintain skill discoverability.** The frontmatter was simplified by removing `triggers`, `allowed-tools`, and `priority` fields. Ensure these removals don't impact how the help skill is discovered or invoked by users. The addition of `user-invocable: true` is appropriate for this skill.
.claude/skills/braintrust-tracing/ref/state.md (1)
`31-40`: **Update path to braintrust analysis script.** Lines 33‚Äì40 list 6 key files involved in Braintrust state management. The braintrust_analyze.py script path is incorrect: it should be `opc/scripts/braintrust_analyze.py`, not `scripts/braintrust_analyze.py`. All hook scripts at `.claude/plugins/braintrust-tracing/hooks/` exist and are correctly documented. > Likely an incorrect or invalid review comment.
.claude/skills/tdd/SKILL.md (1)
`1-75`: **Excellent structural simplification aligned with PR objectives.** All three skill files demonstrate the core optimization pattern: lean SKILL.md serving as quick reference with procedural depth deferred to /ref directories. The content is now more scannable, and the progressive disclosure pattern makes sense for token optimization. Once the minor linting issues are resolved and /ref files verified, these are ready to ship.
.claude/skills/plan-agent/SKILL.md (1)
`92-94`: **Ensure referenced `ref/` files exist in the plan-agent directory.** SKILL.md (lines 92-94) references `ref/plan-template.md` and `ref/decomposition.md`. Verify these files were created as part of this optimization.
.claude/skills/premortem/SKILL.md (2)
`18-82`: **Strong improvement in risk classification approach.** The restructured process‚Äîmoving from a taxonomy-based model to a systematic 5-step risk analysis with explicit severity/likelihood tables and mitigation strategies‚Äîis clearer and more actionable. The addition of quick mode provides valuable time-saving alternative, and the risk summary template is practical. The condensed format aligns well with the PR's progressive-disclosure goal: users get the essential workflow in SKILL.md and can reference detailed templates/categories as needed. --- `84-87`: **Verify that all referenced `/ref/` files exist and are discoverable.** Lines 86‚Äì87 reference two external files: `ref/premortem-template.md` and `ref/risk-categories.md`. Ensure these files are present in `.claude/skills/premortem/ref/` and provide the promised templates and category guidance for users.
.claude/skills/hook-developer/ref/testing.md (1)
`1-51`: **Well-structured testing reference documentation.** This reference file provides practical, actionable guidance for hook testing with proper code block formatting, a useful debugging checklist, and key learnings. The manual test commands and rebuild instructions are clear and ready to use. Complements the lean SKILL.md well.
.claude/skills/implement_task/ref/handoff-template.md (1)
`1-57`: **Comprehensive handoff template with excellent structure.** The template provides a well-organized, standardized format for task handoffs with practical sections (TDD Verification checklist, Decisions Made, Patterns/Learnings) and the Resume Handoff Guide helps downstream readers efficiently extract and apply context. This supports consistent handoff practices across implementations.
.claude/skills/braintrust-tracing/SKILL.md (1)
`53-58`: **Add language specification to bash code block.** Explicitly mark the code block as `bash` for proper syntax highlighting.
üîß Proposed fix ```diff -``` +```bash tail -f ~/.claude/state/braintrust_hook.log ```
> Likely an incorrect or invalid review comment.
.claude/skills/discovery-interview/ref/categories.md (1)
`3-65`: **Well-structured discovery interview reference.** The category framework is logically organized, covers essential investigation domains, and each gap signal effectively highlights common misunderstandings. Clear and actionable for interviewers.
.claude/skills/hook-developer/ref/patterns.md (1)
`1-111`: **High-quality reference patterns for hook implementation.** The patterns provide clear, well-commented examples across Python, Bash, and TypeScript. Each pattern demonstrates safe handling (input validation, error graceful degradation), and the progression from specific event handlers to generic handler templates is instructional.
.claude/skills/implement_task/SKILL.md (1)
`1-74`: **Effective skill condensation while preserving TDD discipline.** The refactored SKILL.md successfully streamlines procedural depth‚Äîremoving prescriptive substeps and lengthy elaborations‚Äîwhile keeping the core workflow (TDD, handoff creation, quick reference guidelines) intact. The shift to reference-based learning via `/ref` folders aligns with the PR's token optimization goal. The process flow remains clear and actionable.
.claude/skills/hook-developer/SKILL.md (1)
`49-62`: **Hook registration example is clear and well-positioned.** The inline JSON example with matcher documentation provides users with a concrete starting point for implementing hooks. The matchers reference (case-sensitive: `Bash`, `Edit|Write`, `mcp__.*`, `*`) is helpful and well-placed.
